page.title: 07PLACES OF INTEREST IN LOXWOO
page.content: {The Jubilee of King George V was {commemorated by a plaque and a tree}at the top of Station Road. These were donated by Miss Smallpiece, the founder of the{Smallpiece Trust.}There is an interesting{village sign}nearby, which was given by the Parish Council in 1984. {The Olde Bakehouse}was built in 1912 and was still in use until 1976 when it was converted into a house. It still has the old flour shoot. {Hilltop Stores}was the first off-license in Loxwood and is 150 years old. At one time the road ran behind the present Post Office and the house next door to it has, as a result, its front door at the back. {Church Cottage}is over 400 years old. The old church used to be on the site.
